definitions.definition: a unit for measuring weight, 116 of a pound, equal to 28.35 grams
a very small quantity of something

examples.text: There's not an ounce of truth in her story.

definitions.definition: it is better to stop something bad from happening rather than try to deal with the problems after it has happened

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French unce, from Latin uncia ‘twelfth part (of a pound or foot)’; compare with inch.
